panels.description: Mapping from actor id to fragment id
panels.title: Actor Id Info

panels.description: Mapping from materialized view table id to it's internal table ids
panels.title: Materialized View Info

panels.description: The number of each type of RisingWave components alive.
panels.title: Node Count

panels.description: The memory usage of each RisingWave component.
panels.title: Node Memory

panels.description: The CPU usage of each RisingWave component.
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: RW cluster can configure multiple meta nodes to achieve high availability. One is the leader and the rest are the followers.
panels.title: Meta Cluster

panels.description: The rate of successful recovery attempts
panels.title: Recovery Successful Rate

panels.description: Total number of failed reocovery attempts
panels.title: Failed recovery attempts

panels.description: Time spent in a successful recovery attempt
panels.title: Recovery latency

panels.description: The figure shows the number of rows read by each source per second.
panels.title: Source Throughput(rows/s)

panels.description: Each query is executed in parallel with a user-defined parallelism. This figure shows the throughput of each parallelism. The throughput of all the parallelism added up is equal to Source Throughput(rows).
panels.title: Source Throughput(rows/s) Per Partition

panels.description: The figure shows the number of bytes read by each source per second.
panels.title: Source Throughput(MB/s)

panels.description: Each query is executed in parallel with a user-defined parallelism. This figure shows the throughput of each parallelism. The throughput of all the parallelism added up is equal to Source Throughput(MB/s).
panels.title: Source Throughput(MB/s) Per Partition

panels.description: RisingWave ingests barriers periodically to trigger computation and checkpoints. The frequency of barrier can be set by barrier_interval_ms. This metric shows how many rows are ingested between two consecutive barriers.
panels.title: Source Throughput(rows) per barrier

panels.description: Monitor each source upstream, 0 means the upstream is not normal, 1 means the source is ready.
panels.title: Source Upstream Status

panels.description: Source Split Change Events frequency by source_id and actor_id
panels.title: Source Split Change Events frequency(events/s)

panels.description: Kafka Consumer Lag Size by source_id, partition and actor_id
panels.title: Kafka Consumer Lag Size

panels.description: The number of rows streamed into each sink per second.
panels.title: Sink Throughput(rows/s)

panels.description: The number of rows streamed into each sink per second.
panels.title: Sink Throughput(rows/s) per Partition

panels.description: The figure shows the number of rows written into each materialized view per second.
panels.title: Materialized View Throughput(rows/s)

panels.description: The figure shows the number of rows written into each materialized view per second.

targets.expr: sum(rate(stream_mview_input_row_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (actor_id, table_id) * on(actor_id, table_id) group_left(table_name) table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}
targets.query: sum(rate(stream_mview_input_row_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (actor_id, table_id) * on(actor_id, table_id) group_left(table_name) table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}

panels.title: Materialized View Throughput(rows/s) per Partition

panels.description: Total number of rows that have been read from the backfill snapshot
panels.title: Backfill Snapshot Read Throughput(rows)

panels.description: Total number of rows that have been output from the backfill upstream
panels.title: Backfill Upstream Throughput(rows)

panels.description: The number of barriers that have been ingested but not completely processed. This metric reflects the current level of congestion within the system.
panels.title: Barrier Number

panels.description: The duration between the time point when the scheduled barrier needs to be sent and the time point when the barrier gets actually sent to all the compute nodes. Developers can thus detect any internal congestion.
panels.title: Barrier Send Latency

panels.description: The time that the data between two consecutive barriers gets fully processed, i.e. the computation results are made durable into materialized views or sink to external systems. This metric shows to users the freshness of materialized views.
panels.title: Barrier Latency

panels.description: The number of actors that have processed the earliest in-flight barriers per second. This metric helps users to detect potential congestion or stuck in the system.
panels.title: Earliest In-Flight Barrier Progress

panels.description: We first record the total blocking duration(ns) of output buffer of each actor. It shows how much time it takes an actor to process a message, i.e. a barrier, a watermark or rows of data, on average. Then we divide this duration by 1 second and show it as a percentage.
panels.title: Actor Output Blocking Time Ratio (Backpressure)

panels.description: The operator-level memory usage statistics collected by each LRU cache
panels.title: Executor Cache Memory Usage

panels.description: Memory usage aggregated by materialized views
panels.title: Executor Cache Memory Usage of Materialized Views

targets.legendFormat: temporal join cache miss, table_id {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
temporal join cache miss, table_id {{table_id}} actor {{actor_id}}

targets.expr: (sum(rate(stream_join_lookup_miss_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (side, join_table_id, degree_table_id, fragment_id) ) / (sum(rate(stream_join_lookup_total_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (side, join_table_id, degree_table_id, fragment_id))
targets.legendFormat: join executor cache miss ratio - - {{side}} side, join_table_id {{join_table_id}} degree_table_id {{degree_table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
targets.query: (sum(rate(stream_join_lookup_miss_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (side, join_table_id, degree_table_id, fragment_id) ) / (sum(rate(stream_join_lookup_total_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (side, join_table_id, degree_table_id, fragment_id))

targets.legendFormat: Agg cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
Distinct agg cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
Stream group top n cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
Stream group top n appendonly cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
Stream lookup cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
Stream temporal join cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}
materialize executor cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}  {{instance}}
Over window cache miss ratio - table {{table_id}} fragment {{fragment_id}}

targets.expr: sum by(le, fragment_id, wait_side, job)(rate(stream_join_barrier_align_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le,fragment_id,wait_side,job) (rate(stream_join_barrier_align_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, fragment_id, wait_side, job)(rate(stream_join_barrier_align_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le,fragment_id,wait_side,job) (rate(stream_join_barrier_align_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Join Actor Input Blocking Time Ratio
Join Actor Match Duration Per Second

panels.description: Multiple rows with distinct primary keys may have the same join key. This metric counts the number of join keys in the executor cache.
panels.title: Join Cached Keys

panels.description: The number of matched rows on the opposite side

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, actor_id, table_id) (rate(stream_join_matched_join_keys_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, fragment_id, table_id) (rate(stream_join_matched_join_keys_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, actor_id, table_id) (rate(stream_join_matched_join_keys_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, fragment_id, table_id) (rate(stream_join_matched_join_keys_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Join Executor Matched Rows
Aggregation Executor Cache Statistics For Each StreamChunk

panels.description: When enabled, this metric shows the input throughput of each executor.

panels.title: Actor Memory Usage (TaskLocalAlloc)
Tokio: Actor Fast Poll Avg Time

Tokio: Actor Slow Poll Avg Time

panels.description: All memory usage of batch executors in bytes
panels.title: Batch Mem Usage

panels.description: This metric shows the memory usage of mem_table.

targets.legendFormat: mem_table size - table id {{table_id}} instance id {{instance_id}} {{job}} @ {{instance}}

panels.title: Mem Table Size

panels.description: This metric shows the item counts in mem_table.

panels.title: Mem Table Count

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(batch_row_seq_scan_next_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(batch_row_seq_scan_next_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(batch_row_seq_scan_next_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(batch_row_seq_scan_next_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: Hummock has three parts of memory usage: 1. Meta Cache 2. Block CacheThis metric shows the real memory usage of each of these three caches.
panels.title: Cache Size

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, instance, table_id)(rate(state_store_iter_merge_sstable_counts_sum{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))  / sum by(le, job, instance, table_id)(rate(state_store_iter_merge_sstable_counts_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, instance, table_id)(rate(state_store_iter_merge_sstable_counts_sum{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))  / sum by(le, job, instance, table_id)(rate(state_store_iter_merge_sstable_counts_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: Histogram of the latency of Get operations that have been issued to the state store.

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, instance, table_id)(rate(state_store_get_duration_sum{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance, table_id) (rate(state_store_get_duration_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, instance, table_id)(rate(state_store_get_duration_sum{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance, table_id) (rate(state_store_get_duration_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Read Duration - Get

panels.description: Histogram of the time spent on iterator initialization.Histogram of the time spent on iterator scanning.

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, instance)(rate(state_store_iter_init_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_iter_init_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, instance)(rate(state_store_iter_init_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_iter_init_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, instance)(rate(state_store_iter_scan_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_iter_scan_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, instance)(rate(state_store_iter_scan_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_iter_scan_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))
targets.query: histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))
targets.query: histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))
targets.query: histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))

targets.expr: sum(histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_iter_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id) + sum((histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id)
targets.query: sum(histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_iter_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id) + sum((histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id)

targets.expr: sum(histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_iter_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id) + sum((histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id)
targets.query: sum(histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_iter_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id) + sum((histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(0.99, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id)

targets.expr: sum(histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_iter_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id) + sum((histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id)
targets.query: sum(histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_iter_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id) + sum((histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_key_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) + histogram_quantile(1.0, sum(rate(state_store_get_value_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id))) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id)

panels.description: The size of a single key-value pair when reading by operation Get.Operation Get gets a single key-value pair with respect to a caller-specified key. If the key does not exist in the storage, the size of key is counted into this metric and the size of value is 0.
panels.title: Read Throughput - Get

panels.description: The size of all the key-value paris when reading by operation Iter.Operation Iter scans a range of key-value pairs.
panels.title: Read Throughput - Iter

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, instance, table_id) (rate(state_store_iter_fetch_meta_duration_sum{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance, table_id) (rate(state_store_iter_fetch_meta_duration_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, instance, table_id) (rate(state_store_iter_fetch_meta_duration_sum{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance, table_id) (rate(state_store_iter_fetch_meta_duration_count{table_id=~"$table|",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: This metric shows the real memory usage of uploader.
panels.title: Uploader Memory Size

panels.description: Histogram of time spent on compacting shared buffer to remote storage.

targets.expr: sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_sync_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_sync_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))
targets.query: sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_sync_duration_sum{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(le, job, instance) (rate(state_store_sync_duration_count{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Build and Sync Sstable Duration

targets.expr: sum(histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_write_batch_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id, table_name)
targets.query: sum(histogram_quantile(0.5, sum(rate(state_store_write_batch_size_bucket{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (le, job, instance, table_id)) * on(table_id) group_left(materialized_view_id) (group(table_info{job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}) by (materialized_view_id, table_id))) by (materialized_view_id, table_name)

panels.description: compact-task: The total time have been spent on compaction.
panels.title: Compaction Duration

panels.description: KBs read from next level during history compactions to next level
panels.title: Compaction Throughput

panels.description: The number of bytes that have been written by compaction.Flush refers to the process of compacting Memtables to SSTables at Level 0.Write refers to the process of compacting SSTables at one level to another level.
panels.title: Compaction Write Bytes(GiB)

panels.description: Write amplification is the amount of bytes written to the remote storage by compaction for each one byte of flushed SSTable data. Write amplification is by definition higher than 1.0 because we write each piece of data to L0, and then write it again to an SSTable, and then compaction may read this piece of data and write it to a new SSTable, that's another write.
panels.title: Compaction Write Amplification

panels.description: The number of SSTables that is being compacted at each level
panels.title: Compacting SSTable Count

panels.title: Compacting Task Count

panels.description: There are two types of operations: 1. GET, SELECT, and DELETE, they cost 0.0004 USD per 1000 requests. 2. PUT, COPY, POST, LIST, they cost 0.005 USD per 1000 requests.Reading from S3 across different regions impose extra cost. This metric assumes 0.01 USD per 1GB data transfer. Please checkout AWS's pricing model for more accurate calculation.

targets.legendFormat: GET, SELECT, and all other Requests Cost
PUT, COPY, POST, LIST Requests Cost

panels.title: Estimated S3 Cost (Realtime)

panels.description: This metric uses the total size of data in S3 at this second to derive the cost of storing data for a whole month. The price is 0.023 USD per GB. Please checkout AWS's pricing model for more accurate calculation.
panels.title: Estimated S3 Cost (Monthly)

targets.expr: sum(rate(foyer_storage_op_duration_count{op="lookup",extra="hit",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (foyer, instance) / (sum(rate(foyer_storage_op_duration_count{op="lookup",extra="hit",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (foyer, instance) + sum(rate(foyer_storage_op_duration_count{op="lookup",extra="miss",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (foyer, instance))
targets.query: sum(rate(foyer_storage_op_duration_count{op="lookup",extra="hit",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (foyer, instance) / (sum(rate(foyer_storage_op_duration_count{op="lookup",extra="hit",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (foyer, instance) + sum(rate(foyer_storage_op_duration_count{op="lookup",extra="miss",job=~"$job",instance=~"$node"}[$__rate_interval])) by (foyer, instance))

panels.description:
Objects are classified into 3 groups:
- not referenced by versions: these object are being deleted from object store.
- referenced by non-current versions: these objects are stale (not in the latest version), but those old versions may still be in use (e.g. long-running pinning). Thus those objects cannot be deleted at the moment.
- referenced by current version: these objects are in the latest version.

Additionally, a metric on all objects (including dangling ones) is updated with low-frequency. The metric is updated right before full GC. So subsequent full GC may reduce the actual value significantly, without updating the metric.
